result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont D. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI 7th Offense, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 18CF1577, 18CF1578, 18CF1773, 19CF535, 19CF980, 22CF369, 22CT33 are called at 1:35 PM) Defendant Lamont D. Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Lamont D. Davis.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates a plea agreement regarding the 2022 cases. Defense indicates no additions or corrections to the revocation packet. State outlines jail credit and requests that any issues or disagreements regarding jail credit be briefed by counsel. 
State makes sentence argument in 18CF1577, 18CF1578, 18CF1773, 19CF535, 19CF980. Defense makes sentence argument in 18CF1577, 18CF1578, 18CF1773, 19CF535, 19CF980. Defense makes argument regarding jail credit including any time in Federal custody. State responds to Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
22CF369- Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF369 Count 1- OWI 7th Offense. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty in 22CF369. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including 22CT33, 22TR2251. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court orders in 22CF369: 3 years of Initial Confinement and 4 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence with 108 days credit. 
Court orders conditions of Extended Supervision in 22CF369: $600 fine plus costs; Mayo Blood Draw Fee $39; AODA and follow through with recommendations; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; 24 months Ignition Interlock Device; Lifetime Driver's License revocation. 
Court orders in 18CF1577 Count 1: 6 months jail concurrent to any other sentence with 109 days credit. 
Court orders in 18CF1578 Count 1: 2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence with 109 days credit. 
Court orders in 18CF1773 Count 1: 18 months Initial Confinement and 18 months Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence with 141 days credit.  Count 6: 7 months jail concurrent to any other sentence. Count 7: 7 months jail concurrent to any other sentence.  Count 9: 18 months Initial Confinement and 18 months Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence.     
Court orders in 19CF535 Count 1: 3 years of Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervision consecutive to 18CF1578 with 110 days credit. Count 8: 7 months jail concurrent to any other sentence.    
Court orders in 19CF980 Count 2: 2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence with 313 days credit.  Count 8: 7 months jail concurrent to any other sentence. Count 9: 7 months jail concurrent to any other sentence. 
Court finds the Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program in all cases.  
Court orders conditions of Extended Supervision in 18CF1577, 18CF1578, 18CF1773, 19CF535, 19CF980: Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Court orders any remaining financial obligations are reduced to a civil judgment. 
Court orders counsel may submit briefs regarding any credit issues.

Letter from Defendant to Court regarding sentencing.
Received by USPS Mail, no indication on copies to other parties.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:00 PM cases 22CT33 and 22CF369 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lamont D. Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Lamont D. Davis. In 22CF369: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Accepted by the Court. Defense advises there is a revocation pending in May that may affect these matters. . 
Both files are scheduled for a status conference 7/21/22 at 10:30 in person (30 min).
Arraignment on May 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Same as Complaint.

2:08 PM Cases called: 22CF369 & 22CT33 Defendant Lamont D. Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Lamont D. Davis.  Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin.  The parties are here for a Preliminary Hearing in 22CF369.

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Cases are referred to Br. 3 for scheduling arraignment.

Public Defender's Office has not been able to find and appoint counsel for this defendant. Court modifies the cash bond amount down and modifies conditions. Defendant may be on a Probation hold. 

Preliminary Hearing is rescheduled.

Preliminary hearing on April 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

(Case called at 11:03 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Lamont Davis appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Monica Fallon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. State requests $10,000 cash bond- Defendant on State and Federal Probation. Defense requests lower cash bond. Court orders $1,000 cash bond with various conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Preliminary Hearing: 04/05/2022 at 2:00 PM.
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
